title: Welcome!
text:
Hello! I am Brendan Karadenes, a senior Data Science major at St. Lawrence University.
I have worked on numerous projects in R, Python, and Java. I am most interested in modeling sports data.

title: Projects
text:
SCORE is a national network for developing and disseminating Sports Content for Outreach, Research, and Education in data science, funded by the National Science Foundation.
I worked on this project during my junior year spring semester and the following summer as a summer fellow. My main role in the project was a content creator - producing modules and working with my classmates and professors to create data science education materials to place in the SCORE network.
Examples of the work can be found here:

https://modules.scorenetwork.org/: contains the completed modules produced across all of SCORE.
https://data.scorenetwork.org/: A data repository containing sports related datasets.
https://iramler.github.io/slu_score_preprints/: A repository of in-development modules produced by St. Lawrence University students and faculty. Many of the modules linked here are currently under review for inclusion in the SCORE Network’s repository linked above.

title: Projects
text:
MLB Spray Charts Shiny App
I created a shiny app displaying Major League Baseball batting spray charts for the 2019-2023 playoffs. The app includes the different types of balls in play, filters for distance and exit velocity, and whether a player was a pull, opposite field, or evenly spread hitter. The app can be found Here.

title: Projects
text:
Megadetector
For my current computer science internship for Nature Up North I am working on modifying Microsoft’s Megadetector python script in order to automate game camera image sorting that Nature Up North receives from community members. The repository for this can be found Here.

title: About
text:
As a senior at St. Lawrence University, I have worked on various projects focused on visualizing data and statistics education.
This past summer (2024) I worked on developing modules for the SCORE Network with Dr. Ivan Ramler and Dr. Robin Lock. The modules include statistics and data science education materials for underrepresented sports including professional woman’s hockey, olympic swimming, UFC, and more.
For my senior year honors project I will be using cluster analysis in python working with MLB pitch data with Dr. Ramler.

title: Courses
text:
Here are some details about the relevant coursework that I have completed at St. Lawrence University.






Applied Regression Analysis





A mid-level statistics class focused on applying data using R. Topics include simple and multiple linear regression, model diagnostics and testing, residual analysis, transformations, indicator variables, variable selection techniques, logistic regression, and analysis of variance.









Intro to Data Science





The course focused on applying data science and statistical methods using R. Topics included data manipulation and visualization, programming, string manipulation, and modern data sources (such as web and databases). This course taught the building blocks of larger scale data science projects.









Data Structures





The course used strategies in Java to organize, process, and retrieve data. Topics included arrays, lists, stacks, queues, maps, trees, and algorithm analysis.









Data Visualization





An upper level statistics class focused on visualizing data using R. Topics include mapping data, linear regression, logistic regression, interactivity, and building a shiny app. The course includes an introduction to computer analysis of data with a statistical computing package. There was a heavy focus on ethically communicating and presenting data.
